[MY PREVIOUS ACTION - Turn 43]
Reasoning: **Navigating the River: A Tactical Poker Hand**

Alright, let's break this down. Small Blind, Round 6, 2000 chips needed. The core objective is clear: hit 2000 chips. Economy is key: I'm incentivized to hoard those discards - $2 per untouched one, potentially $8 this round. I need to keep Perkeo in mind, but no consumables yet. The current hand is interesting, four hearts, three nines, and a few valuable jokers.

I have to carefully evaluate the best possible play for this hand. Droll Joker goes off with the Flush, which would be ideal, especially with Gros Michel, so I want to maximize my chances of hitting it. Three-of-a-kind is a good fallback, so I'll see if it is enough. Discarding feels like a very poor option, especially since I'm trying to use as few discards as possible for that tasty Delayed Gratification bonus. Economy is king.

If I play the Three of a Kind with the 9s, I'll need some luck in the next hand. If I can draw a heart, then I can hit the Flush and the Droll Joker will become very important! Playing the 9s looks too weak on its own to win.

So, the optimal play looks like this: I have to play a low-scoring hand so that I can hopefully draw the Flush. This gives the best chance to hit big on the next hand and get over 2000 chips. I will have to play this carefully to ensure that it has the best chance of scoring the Flush.

I have three 9s! So I should draw them out and discard the other cards that don't help with the Flush. The question is how to discard the other cards. I'm going to play for a Pair and will try to get a better hand. So, the Pair of 9s it is!

Ultimately, the best strategy is to lay a hand to hit that Flush and avoid discards. Play 1, 2, 7, 8: Ace of Spades, 6 of Spades, 9 of Clubs, 9 of Diamonds. That gives a pair of 9s to make some chips. Now, draw 4 to hit the Flush. If not, I can play the remaining hands with the hearts to build up enough points.



Command: play 1 2 7 8 pair 714

My hand: 10 of Hearts, 9 of Hearts, 5 of Hearts, 5 of Hearts, 3 of Hearts, 2 of Hearts, 8 of Clubs, 7 of Diamonds. I have a flush staring me in the face with six hearts (10, 9, 5, 5, 3, 2). # Available Commands
The possible commands in Balatro are all composed of a single word specifying the action, followed by any necessary positional arguments, which are lists of integers.
Note: all position arguments are 1-indexed.

The following commands are available in your current game state.
use_consumable <consumeable_position> <target_card_position1> <target_card_position2> ... <target_card_positionN> - Use a consumeable from the consumeables section. The first position argument is the position within your consumables inventory of the consumable you'd like to use. Subsequent position arguments specify the cards in hand that the consumeable will be used on, if that consumeable requires targets.
sell_consumable <consumeable_position> - Sell a consumeable from the consumeables section.
rearrange_jokers <joker1> <joker2> ... <jokerN> - Rearrange the list of currently owned jokers. Every index in the list of current jokers must be present, i.e. if there are 5 jokers, the indices 1-5 must be present.
sell_joker <joker_position> - Sell a joker from the jokers section.
buy_card <card_position> - Buy a card from the card section. Individual Joker cards are also bought from the card section.
buy_booster <booster_pack_position> - Buy a booster pack from the booster pack section.
buy_voucher <voucher_position> - Buy a voucher from the voucher section.
buy_and_use_consumable <consumable_position> - Buy a consumable type card (Tarot, Planet, Spectral) from the card section and use it immediately. Cannot do this if the consumable requires target hand cards.
round_select - Finish shopping and go to the round select screen.
reroll_shop - Spends the reroll cost to reroll the cards section of the shop.
